intro: Bradleia sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese bradleia, is a rare and striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its unique morphology makes it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and conservation programs. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Bradleia sinensis is considered endangered, highlighting the need for its protection.
